original: Hagwall, Wilhelm Arthur Yngve, kommendörkapten, Karlskrona, f. 20/ 9/04 i Västervik av kapt. v. Skarab. reg. Hans Arthur H. o. Märtha Allvin. G. 29 m. Inga Borgstedt. Barn: Gunvor f. 30, Claes 33, Maj 36. — Stud:ex. i Skövde 22, KSHS aillm. kurs 31-32, torpedkurs 33-34. Fänrik v. flottan 25, und:löjtn. 27, löjtn. 28, kapt. 38, komm:kapt. av andra gr. 44. Ett flertal år lär. i torpedlära v. KSS, tj:gjort som fartygschef på flera ubåtar samt ,som div:chef 40-42, chef f. torped- o. mindep. i Karlskrona sed. 44. Medföljt sjöexp. t. avlägsna farv. 22-23. RSOlkl, marinens M f. skjutn. m. torped.
translated: Hagwall, Wilhelm Arthur Yngve, Commander Captain, Karlskrona, born on September 20th, 1904 in Västervik to Captain of Västgöta Regiment Hans Arthur H. and Märtha Allvin. Married in 1929 to Inga Borgstedt. Children: Gunvor born in 1930, Claes born in 1933, and Maj born in 1936. He passed his studentexamen in Skövde in 1922 and went on to attend the Royal Swedish Naval Staff College's general course from 1931-1932 and the torpedo course from 1933-1934. He enlisted in the navy as a midshipman in 1925, became a sub-lieutenant in 1927, a lieutenant in 1928, captain in 1938, and Commander Captain of the second group in 1944. He taught for several years in torpedo training at the Royal Naval Academy in Karlskrona and served as commanding officer on several submarines and as divisional commander from 1940-1942 and chief of torpedo and mine depots in Karlskrona since 1944. He accompanied a naval expedition to distant waters in 1922-1923. He was awarded the Order of the Sword, Officer 1st Class and the Navy Medal for Shooting with Torpedoes.

structured.name: Wilhelm Arthur Yngve Hagwall
structured.description: Wilhelm Arthur Yngve Hagwall was a Swedish Commander Captain in the Royal Swedish Navy. He was born on September 20th, 1904, in Västervik to Captain of Västgöta Regiment Hans Arthur H. and Märtha Allvin. He married Inga Borgstedt in 1929 and had three children: Gunvor, Claes, and Maj. Hagwall passed his studentexamen in Skövde in 1922 and attended the Royal Swedish Naval Staff College's general course from 1931-1932 and the torpedo course from 1933-1934. He enlisted in the navy as a midshipman in 1925, became a sub-lieutenant in 1927, a lieutenant in 1928, captain in 1938, and Commander Captain of the second group in 1944. Hagwall taught for several years in torpedo training at the Royal Naval Academy in Karlskrona and served as commanding officer on several submarines and as divisional commander from 1940-1942 and chief of torpedo and mine depots in Karlskrona since 1944. He accompanied a naval expedition to distant waters in 1922-1923. Hagwall was awarded the Order of the Sword, Officer 1st Class, and the Navy Medal for Shooting with Torpedoes.
